snippet: The company is considering several options after it posted an annual loss of €4.7 billion, or $6.2 billion, after writing down the value of its domestic business.
abstract: Telecom Italia says it might sell its fixed-line phone network as it looks to reduce its debt burden and stem losses; reports a 2011 loss of 4.7 billion euros ($6.2 billion) after writing down the value of its domestic business by 7.3 billion euros ($9.7 billion).
lead_paragraph: The company is considering several options after it posted an annual loss of €4.7 billion, or $6.2 billion, after writing down the value of its domestic business.

headline.seo: Telecom Italia May Sell Fixed-Line Network
headline.main: Telecom Italia May Sell Fixed-Line Network
headline.print_headline: Telecom Italia Weighs Sale Of Landline Phone Network
